channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [HIVE-2293] Log a warning message when deprecated configuration properties are set
item.summary: Log a warning message when deprecated configuration properties are set

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Hive should log a warning message when deprecated configuration properties are set in the hive-site.xml file. In order to do this we need to maintain a list of deprecated configuration properties in HiveConf.

item.title: [HIVE-2294] Allow ShimLoader to work with Hadoop 0.20-append
item.description: If we are running Hive with Hadoop 0.20-append, Hive ShimLoader does not get Hadoop version correctly. Suffix starts with '-' should be removed from major version info.
item.summary: Allow ShimLoader to work with Hadoop 0.20-append

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch for HIVE-2294
Re-create a patch from svn
Typo: surfix -> suffix
Fix typo and re-create a patch

I see the version on branch-0.20-append is fine. It is 0.20.3-SNAPSHOT from the branch.
[amarsri@xxx branch-0.20-append]$ bin/hadoop version
Hadoop 0.20.3-SNAPSHOT
Subversion https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/common/branches/branch-0.20-append -r 1057313
Compiled by amarsri on Mon Aug 1 16:09:04 IST 2011

What problem are you facing with this branch?
My bad. I checked again but could not reproduce the problem with hadoop-0.20 branch. This might be my classpath problem. I'll reopen this issue if I reproduce the problem correctly.

item.title: [HIVE-2295] Implement CLUSTERED BY, DISTRIBUTED BY, SORTED BY directives for a single query level.
item.description:
The common framework for utilizing the mapreduce framework looks like this:

SELECT TRANSFORM(a.foo, a.bar)
USING 'mapper.py'
AS x, y, z
FROM (
SELECT b.foo, b.bar
FROM tablename b
CLUSTER BY b.foo
) a;

...however, this is exceptionally fragile, as it relies on the assumption that Hive is not doing any "magic" in between the query steps. People familiar with SQL frequently assume that query steps are effectively separated from each other. CLUSTER BY, then, would guarantee that data are clustered on their way OUT of the query, but really what we need is a directive to indicate that data must be clustered on the way INTO the query.

This is not pedantic, because there is no reason that Hive wouldn't try to optimize data flow between queries, for example, systematically splitting up big queries. The UDAF framework, with its merging step, would allow a single key/value pair to be split across SEVERAL reducers, "violating" the mapreduce assumptions but returning the correct data...however, for a TRANSFORM statement, no such protections are afforded.

I propose, for greater clarity, that these directives be part of the same query level. Example syntax:

SELECT TRANSFORM(foo, bar)
USING 'reducer.py'
AS x, y, z
FROM tablename
CLUSTERED BY foo;

...in other words, move the directive regarding data distribution to the query that actually cares about it, allowing for users who are making the assumptions of the mapreduce framework to formally indicate that their transformer really DOES need clustered data. Or to put it in other words, CLUSTER BY is a directive guaranteeing that data are clustered on the way OUT OF a query (i.e., for bucketed tables), whereas CLUSTERED BY is a directive guaranteeing that data are clustered on the way INTO a query.

Bonus points: For tables that are already CLUSTERED BY in their definition, allow this query to run in the map phase.
item.summary: Implement CLUSTERED BY, DISTRIBUTED BY, SORTED BY directives for a single query level.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-2296] bad compressed file names from insert into
item.description:
When INSERT INTO is run on a table with compressed output (hive.exec.compress.output=true) and existing files in the table, it may copy the new files in bad file names:

Before INSERT INTO:
000000_0.gz

After INSERT INTO:
000000_0.gz
000000_0.gz_copy_1

This causes corrupted output when doing a SELECT * on the table.
Correct behavior should be to pick a valid filename such as:
000000_0_copy_1.gz
item.summary: bad compressed file names from insert into

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: add unit test

Fixes problem of bad compressed file names by stripping off the file format (ex ".gz") and reappending it to the path later.

This addresses bug HIVE-2296.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-2296

item.title: [HIVE-2297] Fix NPE in ConditionalResolverSkewJoin
item.summary: Fix NPE in ConditionalResolverSkewJoin

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Some of the file systems can return null if there are no objects to list.
Added a fix for that.

From what I know about the java compiler it will simply stop evaluating the rest of the line if
fstatus != null is false. So the brackets don't add anything. A lot of code is written with this knowledge in mind.

I generated the patch from 0.7 branch and then rebased it to 0.8.
Didn't realize that it was already fixed in 0.8 while generating the patch.
I will resolve this.

Thanks
Vaibhav

item.title: [HIVE-2298] Fix UDAFPercentile to tolerate null percentiles
item.description:
UDAFPercentile when passed null percentile list will throw a null pointer exception.
Submitting a small fix for that.
item.summary: Fix UDAFPercentile to tolerate null percentiles

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

item.description:
Added an optimization to the way input splits are computed.
Reduced an O(n^2) operation to O n operation.

item.title: [HIVE-2300] Move TempStatsStore directory to build/test
item.summary: Move TempStatsStore directory to build/test

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-2301] Throw error when attempting to create a column with the same name as a partition column
item.description:
If an alter table is run to rename a column to the same name as a partition column, the alter will succeed. However, subsequent operations on that table will fail.

hive> create table tmp_pyang_test (key string) partitioned by (ds string);
OK
Time taken: 4.773 seconds
hive> alter table tmp_pyang_test replace columns (ds string);
OK
Time taken: 1.254 seconds
hive> describe tmp_pyang_test;
FAILED: Error in metadata: Partition column name ds conflicts with table columns.
FAILED: Execution Error, return code 1 from org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.DDLTask
hive>
item.summary: Throw error when attempting to create a column with the same name as a partition column

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
This is now working in trunk. we can close this issue

hive> create table tmp_pyang_test (key string) partitioned by (ds string);
OK
Time taken: 0.663 seconds
hive> alter table tmp_pyang_test replace columns (ds string);
Invalid table columns : Partition column name ds conflicts with table columns.
FAILED: Execution Error, return code 1 from org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.exec.DDLTask

item.title: [HIVE-2302] Allow grant privileges on granting privileges.
item.description:
Today any user can grant him and any other users privileges on schemas and tables.

This way the administrator can not be sure that the rules he had apply are fulfilled.
item.summary: Allow grant privileges on granting privileges.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: In my opinion, there should be an "authorized" list as to who can perform the actual grant/revoke privileges...etc.
Are there any plans of implementing this feature in an upcoming release? Thanks!
It's on my queue, although at the moment I don't have a reasonable estimate for when it will be done. Anyone is welcome to take it if they need it sooner.
This is now possible via SQL std based authorization introduced in HIVE-5837 which is going to be available in Hive 0.13

item.title: [HIVE-2303] files with control-A,B are not delimited correctly.
item.description:
The following is from one of our users:

create external table impressions (imp string, msg string)
row format delimited
fields terminated by '\t'
lines terminated by '\n'
stored as textfile
location '/xxx';

Some strings in my data contains Control-A, Control-B etc as internal delimiters. If I do a

Select * from impressions limit 10;

All fields were able to print correctly. However if I do a

Select * from impressions where msg regexp '.*' limit 10;

The fields were broken by the control characters. The difference between the 2 commands is that the latter requires a map-reduce job.
item.summary: files with control-A,B are not delimited correctly.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This problem occurs because FileSinkOperator generates a TableDesc with default properties for storing the output. Solution is to escape the delimiters for the output table.

Shouldn't escaping of delimiters happen always in LazySimpleSerde?
Patch adds escape property to the default output table.

item.title: [HIVE-2304] Support PreparedStatement.setObject
item.description: PreparedStatement.setObject is important for spring's jdbcTemplate support

item.title: [HIVE-2305] UNION ALL on different types throws runtime exception
item.description:
Ex:
SELECT * (SELECT 123 FROM ... UNION ALL SELECT '123' FROM ..) t;

Unioning columns of different types currently throws runtime exceptions.
item.summary: UNION ALL on different types throws runtime exception

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
For multiple input directories, UnionOperator was not correctly setting the object inspector for the new row schema.
Also fixed incorrect call to get a common class.
Fixes for UNION ALL implicit type conversion bugs
fix upstream input file change propagation

-Added getCommonClassForUnion (needed since getCommonClass returns null for complex types)
-Added unit text
-Fixed changed existing unit test output

-----------------------------------------------------------
This is an automatically generated e-mail. To reply, visit:
https://reviews.apache.org/r/1223/
-----------------------------------------------------------

Review request for hive.

Summary
-------

UNION ALL on columns of different types is semantically allowed but throws a runtime exception due to bugs in getting the correct object inspector after the parent MR input file is change and in setting the TypeInfo for the union row schema.

This addresses bug hive-2305.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/hive-2305

item.title: [HIVE-2306] Hbase's timestamp attribute to be mapped for read or write, and then import data of timestamp to hbase's table from hive
item.description:
Current column mapping dosn't support hbase's timestamp column to be mapped for read or write, and import data of timestamp to hbase's table from hive.

I find HIVE-1228 mentioned this issue,but not to address the :timestamp requirement at last. And https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HBaseIntegration said that "there is currently no way to access the HBase timestamp attribute, and queries always access data with the latest timestamp."

Would allow timestamp to be map to hive(just like Get in hbase API) or "INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE hbase_table_1" with timestamp from hive(like Put in hbase API)?
item.summary: Hbase's timestamp attribute to be mapped for read or write, and then import data of timestamp to hbase's table from hive

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
What is the status of this ticket?
Can someone tell me if this is going to be pushed? or any reason why its not pushed?

This is a good feature and we have come to a couple of situations where this support is good to have.

The current patch might not be applicable to the current version Hive 0.13, but I can work on it (in-fact I have a patch available with the current trunk but slightly different implementation).

item.title: [HIVE-2307] Schema creation scripts for PostgreSQL use bit(1) instead of boolean
item.description:
The specified type for DEFERRED_REBUILD (IDXS) and IS_COMPRESSED (SDS) columns in the metastore is defined as bit(1) type which is not supported by PostgreSQL JDBC.

hive> create table test (id int);
FAILED: Error in metadata: javax.jdo.JDODataStoreException: Insert of object "org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.model.MStorageDescriptor@4f1adeb7" using statement "INSERT INTO "SDS" ("SD_ID","INPUT_FORMAT","OUTPUT_FORMAT","LOCATION","SERDE_ID","NUM_BUCKETS","IS_COMPRESSED") VALUES (?,?,?,?,?,?,?)" failed : ERROR: column "IS_COMPRESSED" is of type bit but expression is of type boolean
item.summary: Schema creation scripts for PostgreSQL use bit(1) instead of boolean

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Committed to trunk. Thanks Esteban!
Committed to trunk. Thanks Esteban!

Integrated in Hive-trunk-h0.21 #857 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/857/)

item.title: [HIVE-2308] Throw an error if user specifies unsupported FS in LOCATION clause of CREATE TABLE
item.summary: Throw an error if user specifies unsupported FS in LOCATION clause of CREATE TABLE

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
For example, Hive currently doesn't support the ability to query data stored in S3 (see HIVE-1620), but it will still let you create an external table that specifies an S3 volume for the location:

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE tests3
(
a INT,
b STRING
)
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED FIELDS TERMINATED BY '|'
LOCATION 's3n://FULL/adsexternal/1294963200';

item.title: [HIVE-2309] Incorrect regular expression for extracting task id from filename
item.description:
For producing the correct filenames for bucketed tables, there is a method in Utilities.java that extracts out the task id from the filename and replaces it with the bucket number. There is a bug in the regex that is used to extract this value for attempt numbers >= 10:

>>> re.match("^.*?([0-9]+)(_[0​-9])?(\\..*)?$", 'attempt_201107090429_6496​5_m_001210_10').group(1)
'10'
>>> re.match("^.*?([0-9]+)(_[0​-9])?(\\..*)?$", 'attempt_201107090429_6496​5_m_001210_9').group(1)
'001210'
item.summary: Incorrect regular expression for extracting task id from filename

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: can we limit number of digits for the attempt ID?
+1, will commit after tests pass
commited. Thanks Paul!

item.title: [HIVE-2310] CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE should require a valid LOCATION clause
item.summary: CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE should require a valid LOCATION clause

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE does not require the user to specify a LOCATION clause:

hive> CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE ext(a INT);
OK
hive> DESCRIBE FORMATTED ext;
...                	 
Location:           	file:/user/hive/warehouse/ext	 <--- NOT GOOD
Table Type:         	EXTERNAL_TABLE      	 
hive>

We should make the following changes:

  • Require the user to specify a valid LOCATION clause for CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE statements.
  • Throw an error if the user specifies a LOCATION that is a subdirectory of hive.metastore.warehouse.dir

Implementing the above changes seems to break TestHBaseCliDriver_hbase_queries.q
Some EXTERNAL tables are created in that test but they throw an error if I try to specify a LOCATION.

Any thoughts?
Non-native external tables (such as HBase tables) should neither require nor allow a LOCATION clause.
initial patch

-----------------------------------------------------------
This is an automatically generated e-mail. To reply, visit:
https://reviews.apache.org/r/1444/
-----------------------------------------------------------

Review request for John Sichi and Carl Steinbach.

Summary
-------

-Require the user to specify a valid LOCATION clause for CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE statements (except non-native tables).
-Throw an error if the user specifies a LOCATION that is a subdirectory of hive.metastore.warehouse.dir

This addresses bug hive-2310.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/hive-2310

Diffs

trunk/ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/parse/ErrorMsg.java 1155176

trunk/ql/src/test/queries/clientpositive/alter2.q 1155176
trunk/ql/src/test/queries/clientpositive/create_like.q 1155176

trunk/ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/alter2.q.out 1155176
trunk/ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/create_like.q.out 1155176
trunk/ql/src/test/results/clientpositive/create_like_view.q.out 1155176

Diff: https://reviews.apache.org/r/1444/diff

Testing
-------

unit tests pass

Thanks,

Franklin

What about following:

create table mytbl (a string) location '/tmp/tbl';

Is it fine to allow location for a table without it being 'external' ? I think semantics should be if you want to specify location then table must be external.
@Ashutosh, HIVE-109 deals with restricting location only to external tables.
@Franklin: Looks like the patch has gone stale. If you rebase it I will take a look. Thanks.
Rebase since patch was stale

item.title: [HIVE-2311] TRANSFORM statements should come with their own ROW FORMATs.
item.description:
Sometimes Hive tables contain tabs and/or other characters that could easily be misinterpreted by a transformer as a delimiter. This can break many TRANSFORM queries.

The solution is to have a ROW FORMAT semantics that can be attached to an individual TRANSFORM instance. It would have the same semantics as table creation, but during serialization it would ensure that any formal delimiter characters that did not indicate an actual break between columns would be escaped.

At the very least, it is a bug that TRANSFORM statement deserialization does not backslash out literal tabs in the current implementation.
item.summary: TRANSFORM statements should come with their own ROW FORMATs.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-2312] Make CLI variables available to UDFs
item.description:
Straightforward use case: My UDFs should be able to condition on whether hive.mapred.mode=strict or nonstrict.

But these things could also be useful for certain optimizations. For example, a UDAF knowing that there is only one reduce phase could avoid a lot of pushing data around unnecessarily.
item.summary: Make CLI variables available to UDFs

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
